title: Enable/Disable Instrument Connectivity Menus

body.body: To enable the instrument connectivity menus:
Connect the Triumph diagnostic tool and turn the ignition ON.
Navigate to CHASSIS DIAGNOSTICS - INSTRUMENT DIAGNOSTICS - Adjust.
The connectivity menus will be enabled providing the following conditions have been met:
A Connectivity Module must be installed.
The Connectivity Module calibration must be up to date.
The instruments must be programmed with a Connectivity Module ready calibration.
The instruments must be programmed with a valid VIN (this is programmed automatically when downloading a Connectivity Module ready calibration to the instruments).

If any of the above conditions are not met, the diagnostic to will display a message identifying which conditions are not correct. Rectify as necessary before attempting to enable the instrument connectivity menus again.
To disable the instrument connectivity menus:
Connect the Triumph diagnostic tool and turn the ignition ON.
Navigate to CHASSIS DIAGNOSTICS - INSTRUMENT DIAGNOSTICS - Adjust.
